We tried just about everything and they were all excellent.  Starting with the fried potato ball, which he asked if we like spicy. Of course I said yes and although I wasn't disappointed, it certainly was very spicy.  From there it was on to the muscles in a soup broth. Also very good and as a hand I suggest putting the crust from the tomato bread into the broth for a few seconds to soak it all up.  After this was the grilled squid. This was by far the best thing we had. So tender, juicy and full of flavor.  From there the garbanzo beans came out, which were added together with a type of mashed up blood sausage I believe.  The last two dishes were shrimp and octopus. Yet again they did not disappoint.The service was outstanding even though they were insanely busy while we were there. We stood at the bar the whole time and everyone there was running around busy but still had time to take our orders and questions.  I really hope that I have the chance to go back again to try a few more things on the menu which I missed. Especially the artichoke which looks amazing, but they were out of it.
